message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.GR 

This paper is about a new high resolution, high frame rate stereo video dataset for tracking and action recognition in the game of ping pong. The dataset can be used for a large variety of machine learning and vision tasks such as tracking, pose estimation, semi-supervised and unsupervised learning and generative modeling. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also introduces several baseline models that were trained on this data, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The dataset can be used for robotics applications, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.RO (Robotics). Finally, the paper explores the properties of ping pong ball trajectories, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.GR (Graphics).
